abstract: An environmental activist describes his shifts on nuclear power and genetically modified crops.
snippet: An environmental activist describes his shifts on nuclear power and genetically modified crops.
lead_paragraph: Keith Kloor has a fascinating interview with the British environmental writer and activist Mark Lynas on the Yale Environment 360 Web site. The exchange centers on Lynas's new book, "The God Species: Saving the Planet in the Age of Humans," and particularly on his conclusion that some technologies that have been anathema to environmentalists are vital to a smooth human journey in this century -- particularly nuclear power and crops developed using biotechnology. Also notable is Lynas's revised view of the "skeptical environmentalist" Bjorn Lomborg, whose face he once plastered with a pie. I encourage you to read it and weigh in here.

headline.main: Environmentalist Explains Shifts on Biotechnology and Nuclear Power
